dialogues.text: Did you kill Debbie? The planchette shoots over to YES. The LIGHTS BRIGHTEN EVEN MORE on everyone’s stunned faces That INHUMAN GROANING SOUND IN THE HOUSE coming from all directions!

dialogues.speaker: LAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you want? Tell us! The planchette zig-zags from letter to letter around the board. A new message -- FNSHGME LAINE (CONT’D) Debbie had the same message in her journal. I don’t know what it means --— Pete looks sick because he figures it out --

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: 'Finish game.' Those two simple words said out loud -- and the game feel more ominous than ever. The players squint against the impossible bright light. The planchette RATTLING LIKE HEL

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THEIR FINGERS
dialogues.text: Isabelle is the first to bail. She yanks her hand away an scrambles back from the board. All of them now pull their hands away... backing away as blinding light fills the room. Laine’s the last one at th board. She pulls her hand away -- -- AND THE PLANCHETTE IS STILL MOVING. BY ITSELF! It’s li a living thing twitching on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Laine -- get away from it! But she can’t pull herself away, shouting at the Ouija bo

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: We're done! Do you hear me? We're not playing the game anymore!  52. She watches as the planchette skitters to the bottom of t board, and then SLOWLY GRINDS across the words that are printed there. WE HOLD VERY CLOSE AS IT MOVES LETTER TO

dialogues.speaker: GOOD BYE
dialogues.text: Laine stares as the overhead light suddenly comes on. Growing brighter along with the other lights. BLINDING. I pops! Glass showering down. Pete pulls Laine away from the falling glass. Both of the now safely against the wall. Lantern bulbs suddenly POP AND BREAK -- the entire BEDROO falling into PITCH DARKNESS. We hear the commotion of everyone screaming in panic. HARD CUT TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the edge of the neighborhood... a dark vacant lot. In distance, THE GROUP stands around a small fire. CLOSER WITH THEM. Some newspaper and a few dry branches burn. Orange light flickers on everyone’s haunted faces.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: What was that -- The fire crackles. No one else says anything. Too rattled Trevor has a little flask out. Coiled tight as he takes a sip. But Isabelle has to talk this out loud, processing -

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean... Debbie made contact with something evil. You could feel it, right? Like it was all over your skin...

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Iz, it’s okay --

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: -- it’s not okay! Because when she played she opened the wrong door or something. The game was just sitting there -- waiting for us.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Please. Stop. Talking. But Isabelle is lost in her own thoughts. In tears now. Words tumbling out --  53.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: -- and then we touched it! We’re all connected now to whatever the hell it is! It got Debbie and now it’s going to get us! --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: -- shut up! Just shut up!

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No. It’s over. Everyone looks over at Pete -- as he tosses the OUIJA BOA on top of the fire. The board starts to catch, curling at the edges.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The board’s gone. The OUIJA BOARD is now fully consumed by the fire. The wo GOOD BYE blister and bubble in the heat. Isabelle wipes her eyes... trying to come down. Sarah stands next to her big sister, as Laine pokes at th burning OUIJA BOARD with a stick. Silent, Trevor takes another sip from his flask, gazing i the flames. The fire pops. Pete stares up... watching the orange spar as they float into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beginning of the day. Cars pulling in the school lot. Sarah, Laine and Isabelle walk toward the school. Silent. No one’s in the mood to talk. Trevor locks his bike to the rack. Sees Laine approaching but he heads off. Won’t even look at her. Something’s forever changed between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laine eats by herself. She looks off, her eyes catch -- PETE. Sitting a few tables away with a couple others of h “type.” He happens to glance over -- sees Laine. He gives her a slight wave. But it’s tinged with some sadness. Everyone back to their usual high school roles. Laine returns the wave. But she feels the distance too.  54. Pete watches for a moment... students passing in front of view... as he goes back to his lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun starts to fade on Laine and Sarah’s house. INT. LAINE AND SARAH’S HOUSE - NIGHT Laine comes down the stairs, rounds the corner... and sto Visibly surprised by something. REVEAL -- Sarah in the kitchen cooking dinner. She’s even set the table. A lit candle flickers. It looks nice. Off Laine’s reaction --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No big deal. I’ve made dinner before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laine and Sarah eat. Laine tries to hide how bad it taste

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: This fish is good.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s chicken. Sarah glances at Laine and they laugh. A beat...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I broke up with that guy. Laine nods. Knows not to lecture.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get my shit together. Stop skipping. Nose to the grindstone and all that. A second chance, you know. These words are a such a relief to Laine.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: I’m really proud of you, Worm.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: C'mon. Don’t get all corny on me. A smile as the two sisters keep eating. No more words nee to be said.  55. INT. LAINE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Laine’s at her desk. Lingering on the black and white pho of her Debbie. She glances over... notices the little keychain figure. Sees that the penguin’s head is coming loose from the body. Laine pulls on the head. It comes off to reveal... the keychain toy is actually a FLASH DRIVE. Laine now has Debbie’s FLASH DRIVE plugged into her compu She clicks through folders. Searching. Opens up a folder called LET’S PLAY that contains various VIDEO FILES. Beat. Laine clicks and opens up the first file. Before we see the image, we hear familiar words --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE AND DEBBIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: As friends we've gathered, hearts are true. Spirits near, we call to you. ON SCREEN. LAPTOP CAM POV. We recognize the tree mural of Debbie's room. Laine sits with Debbie on the bed. Hanging out. They have the Ouija board between them. The footage feels very rece

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Is Blake ever going to actually ask me out -- or will he just keep sending me naughty texts? Both girls have their hands on the planchette. It starts move -- jerky.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Okay. You're being a spaz.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: That's not me --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- yeah, right. The planchette slides to NO. Debbie cuts a look at Laine.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hey -- you're supposed to give me the answers I want to hear --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- I didn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I guess you don’t think he’s right for me --  56.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- moving on. My turn. Laine turns her attention to the board.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ouija. JI heard a rumor that Debbie isn't coming with me to college next year. Is that true? Debbie hesitates. Then visibly pushes the planchette to Y Laine takes her hands off the planchette.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When were you going to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I was trying to find the right time. Listen -- I'm glad you know now because I've been dying to share this with you. I got this amazing opportunity for a photography internship in Spain --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- but we were going to room together and everything. We had a whole plan.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: It's just for a year --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- I can't believe you're doing the to me. Debbie seems crushed by Laine’s reaction.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd be excited. That I landed this, you know. I've always been then there for you. ON LAINE AS SHE WATCHES. Reliving this moment. The regret playing across her face as we hear the argument on the vi escalating. Their voices getting louder. BACK ON THE VIDEO -- Laine gets up. Feeling totally abandoned by Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: But you're leaving me behind --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: -- you're my best friend. This doesn't change anything between us--  57.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: It changes everything! Laine storms out of frame. Debbie is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Laine -- please. Let's talk about this! Debbie follows. Voices continuing off. Long beat. The Ouija sits there. Debbie returns. Climbs back onto her bed. Upset. She regards the board... positions it in front of her. Pu her fingertips on the planchette. Talking to herself, fighting tears about the argument --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Question: Is Laine going to keep acting like such a little bitch? Beat. the planchette TWITCHES. Familiar. Slides to an answer. Not in a way that looks like Debbie moving it, bu that it's really working. It's obvious by Debbie's expression that she's startled by the moment.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. That didn’t just happen. Debbie reaches toward the laptop camera POV -- CLICK. Switching the image off. ON LAINE -- she opens the next file in Debbie’s folder. ON SCREEN. COMPUTER CAM POV. Back in Debbie's room. The OUIJA BOARD is set up on the floor. Camera adjusts down a bit as DEBBIE leans into the frame.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something very weird happened yesterday. So I'm doing a little test... Debbie sits down at the Ouija Board. Alone. Debbie looks right at us... as if talking directly to Lai

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know. I know. Never play alone. But I need to make sure I'm not losing it. Debbie puts her fingertips on the planchette and circles board. Once.  58.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wanted to see if you were out there... whoever was here last night. ON LAINE -- watching the footage intently. She turns the volume up. DEBBIE has her eyes closed... fingers on the planchette. Everything totally still. Nothing happening. FOOTAGE FAST FORWARDS to further in the game. Debbie stil sitting there with her eyes closed. And then the planchet starts to move. THE VIDEO STOPS, rewinds a few seconds th resumes play. The planchette now moves around the board. Spelling --

dialogues.speaker: H I F R EW D
dialogues.text: Debbie stares -- amazed. She's made contact.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa. Hi friend. LAINE is visibly unnerved. Seeing this evidence. Knowing the fateful path her friend is heading down by playing th game alone. A SERIES OF SHOTS as Laine goes through Debbie's files. M CLIPS as the VARIOUS GAMES progress -- Debbie. Another day.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me your name. The planchette slides to “D."

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘D.' Okay. ‘'D' what? The planchette moves fast to another letter -- "Z."

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: ‘DZ.' Hey DeeZee. Cool name. LAINE -- her mind churning. Whispering --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: D.Z. -- who is that? Glimpses of other footage. ANOTHER GAME. Debbie has developed a bond with this “DZ spirit.” She is so at ease Talking to the board like she’s in a confessional --  59.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: .--it's my birthday today and you know what? She didn't even call. So the big plans are dinner with my parents... I'm such a loser. DIFFERENT CLIP. Another bit of dialogue...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...the locker next to mine... see I'm 306... and he’s 305 but he’s got a girlfriend... ON LAINE watching the tape. Realizing --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: My God... she told it everything. ON DEBBIE. She's tentative. Putting herself out there...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You're my friend. Right... DZ? The planchette slides quickly to: B-E-S-T

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Best friends. Cool. Since I'm being completely blown off. Now she won't even answer my texts. I mean... we've been friends our whole lives. Guess I don't exist anymore. ON LAINE as the color drains from her face. She watches a the planchette spells out: N-A-M-E

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Her name? Laine. (beat) Hey. You know the future, D.Z. Right? Will we be friends again... me and Laine? The planchette falls totally still. ON LAINE as she watches. Not taking a breath. And then the planchette slowly starts to drag across the board with an eerie scraping sound. The planchette moving until it lands on -- YES.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I knew it. Laine swallows at the mention of her own name. Clicks the next file --  60. Now -- A DIFFERENT CLIP. Debbie's dark room. We hear her BREATHING, having just quickly grabbed and turned on her camera. Frame adjusting. The sound of something moving in her room.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something's moving... what is that -- A LOUD SCRAPE. Heavy across the floor. Debbie turns on he lamp, catching the last bit of movement as a chair in her room slides by itself against the door. Hold. All we hear is Debbie's BREATHING. ANOTHER CLIP. Debbie stands in her BATHROOM MIRROR, holdi the camera in one hand, pulling her shirt off her shoulde with the other. There's some kind of DARK MARK coming up over the top of her shoulder. She keeps the camera aimed at the mirror, turns around so can see her back... and there's a much LARGER MARK across shoulder blade. Like something smeared on her skin.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--the hell's happening to me...? Debbie wipes at it with her hand. It comes off on her fingers, a dark ash-like substance. ANOTHER CLIP. DEBBIE IS BACK AT THE OUIJA BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's start a new game. How does that sound? Okay. Good. Here we go. As friends we've gathered... (If it sounds familiar, it's because we're now seeing the computer cam POV of what we heard in the opening scene...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was fun for a while, when we first started playing. But... I feel like you've changed. (beat) I mean, you're still my friend, right? The planchette skids down the board to the words GOOD BYE Slowly SCRAPES across the letters (just like it did in Laine’s last game). DEBBIE'S LOOKS RIGHT INTO THE CAMERA, VOICE TREMBLING -—-

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is our last game. I'm not playing ever again! Get out of my room!  61. LAINE KEEPS WATCHING... horrified by Debbie’s rising fear Debbie gets up from the Ouija board and walks out of fram HOLD HERE. The sound of Debbie opening her bedroom door. Footsteps heading down the hall. Everything very still -- -- but in the background... a glass of water begins to ee Slide across Debbie's desk. Image GLITCHES then shuts off Laine sits there staring at the blank screen. A SOUND. Sh slowly glances over... a GLASS OF WATER on her own desk. Beat. And then it slides. Just like on the video. Coming toward her. Smooth and steady. Stops right in front of he Then nothing. Silence. And then -- -- HER WHOLE ROOM ERUPTS! THINGS HURLING OFF THE SHELVES. So sudden and intense. Her laptop goes sliding across the desk and FLIES INTO THE WALL. Laine SCREAMS! Jumps to her feet as Sarah rushes into the room. Breathless. Sarah takes in the destruction with terror in her eyes. S and Laine trade a sick look.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The game...

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -..it’s not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant sits like an island amidst the surrounding empty parking lot. We see Isabelle through the windows... closing up, putting chairs up on the tables as the last t customers leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabelle has the restaurant phone against her ear as she closes out the register.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: .»»-yeah. Dad, I got it. I know to lock your office before I leave. Okay. I’11 be home in a bit. She hangs up. Goes over to the wall and turns out a bank lights. The restaurant FALLING DARK. Isabelle gathers her purse from the counter, pulling keys when she suddenly STARTLES -- because SOMEONE has been sitting in the far corner booth this whole time. Back turned. In the shadows.  62. Isabelle calls out --

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but we're closing up. THE FIGURE doesn’t move. Doesn’t speak. From the shadows, all we can see are two little glints where the eyes would Isabelle is suddenly weak with fear.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you hear me? We're closed. But THE FIGURE -- just. sits. there. Isabelle moves cautiously -- grabs a knife from the count and hits the lights. BAM! No_one is there. Booth empty. Isabelle scans the restaurant -- but she’s alone. She set the knife down. Keys jingle in her hand. Ready to get out of here. She moves for the door... and stops. She stands at the daily special board. Frozen. The letter have been rearranged, spelling out:

dialogues.speaker: FNISH GAME
dialogues.text: Hands trembling, Isabelle pulls her phone from her purse. takes a photo of the FNISH GAME message... as if to prove herself that this is really happening. INT. ISABELLE’S CAR - NIGHT Isabelle pulls her door closed. Freaked out. She glances the rear-view and notices something on her neck. Tilts th mirror down for a better look -- -- to see a DARK MARK across her neck... similar to what saw on the video of Debbie standing at her bathroom mirro Five long steaks down her skin, a larger smudge at the bottom. It looks like a strange HANDPRINT. Isabelle stares. Touches it. Black residue comes off on h fingers. Panic surging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabelle’s car speeds down the deserted late night street INT. ISABELLE’S CAR - NIGHT A heavy condensation has built up on the windshield. Isabelle hits the defrost just as her cell phone on the passenger seat starts RINGING. Isabelle glances over at the caller ID screen -- it’s Lai  She 63. reaches for the phone just as the light turns red. She hits the brakes and the cell phone sliiides off the seat slipping into the darkness underneath the passenger seat. EXT.

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Isabelle is the only car at the intersection. Engine idles... red traffic light bleeding through the night haz INT. ISABELLE’S CAR - NIGHT Isabelle puts the car in PARK. The phone keeps RINGING as she leans over... feeling around under the seat for it. And while she’s down... we notice a light pole outside th car slowing starts MOVING. As if somehow -- impossibly -- the rest of the world is sliding past the stationary car. The pole keeps moving... out of view. Isabelle finally finds her phone, sits up -- and somethin doesn’t feel right. She looks out her window to see --

dialogues.speaker: -- THAT HER CAR NOW SITS SMACK DAB IN THE MIDDLE OF THE
dialogues.text: INTERSECTION. Moved here without her even feeling it. And

dialogues.speaker: ISABELLE
dialogues.text: What... the... as she turns back to the front, Isabelle sees something written in the condensation on the windshield --

dialogues.speaker: HI FREND
dialogues.text: Totally frantic, Isabelle turns. Looking out every window into the empty intersection. Who the hell did that?! She hits the windshield wipers, desperate to get rid of that finger written message. The wipers squeeak back and forth against the glass -- but the letters remain. Isabelle reaches out and runs her hand across the words a to her horror... it wipes away. It was written on the inside of the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes shoot to the rear-view mirror. Checking the back. Nobody there. Just her coat laid across the back seat... ...but something starts to move under her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabelle keeps her eyes glued to the mirror. Doesn’t dare turn around. She keeps watching in disbelief and horror a FIGURE takes form under her coat.  64. Isabelle FUMBLES with the door but she can’t get out. Stu in the car. She shoots another glance to the rear-view -- -- as a HEAD emerges from under the coat. Can’t see a fac Just a dark awful shape. Isabelle struggles with her door. SCREAMING. Unaware that lights are rising on her from the opposite direction. A f approaching BLARE OF A HORN. Isabelle turns -- squints into the BLINDING LIGHT -- -- SMASH! Her car is literally SWEPT OUT OF FRAME! We hol forever on the sudden empty space of the intersection... the night falls quiet again. INT. LAINE’S CAR - NIGHT Laine and Sarah drive. Urgent. Sarah’s on the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Trevor’s not answering.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Isabelle’s probably still closing up -- I already texted her. When we get there we’ll try everyone again. FLASHING LIGHTS slowly rise across their faces. Laine bri the car to a stop. Both sisters looking out the windshiel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laine’s out of the car. Sarah close behind. Laine starts hurry toward the red spinning lights. Remnants of the accident coming into view. Broken glass on the road. EMERGENCY VEHICLES. Isabelle’s SMASHED CAR. Laine moves faster, and now sees -- -- a SHEET COVERED BODY on a stretcher... loaded into the back of an ambulance. Laine stops in her tracks. Shattered.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: No... no... this isn’t happening. Laine staggers back from the scene. Sarah stands on the road, crying. Beside herself. Laine can barely breathe. Slowly spinning. Wishing something could make sense to her right now. There’s a BUZZING sound in the tall grass on the side of road. Something glowing.  65. Numb... Laine walks toward it. Reaches down into the grass... and finds Isabelle’S CELL PHONE. Flung from the vehicle during the accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smear of blood across the screen: 1 MISSED TEXT - LAINE Laine starts going through the phone. Anything that can h her find out what happened. She looks at the recent PHOTO Scrolls through them. Fun shots. Lots of pics of Isabelle and Laine being silly. Then Laine stops. It’s the photo of the MENU BOARD at the restaurant, the message from earlier that night -- LAINE (CONT’D) Finish game.... PULL UP FROM LAINE AND SARAH ON THE ROAD... the red light sweeping across them with a creeping menace and we go -- BLURRY PIXELS OF LIGHT. VOICES. PULLING BACK -- we see th it’s the VIDEO of Laine and Debbie playing the Ouija in Debbie’s room. INT. LAINE’S ROOM - NIGHT Very late. Laine sits at her computer. Watching the footage. Still numb from Isabelle’s death.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Is Blake ever going to actually ask me out -- or will he just keep sending me naughty texts? Both girls have their hands on the planchette. It starts move -- jerky.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Okay. You're being a spaz.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: That's not me --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, right. Laine stops. Rewinds. Watches that moment again. The JERK FAMILIAR MOVEMENT OF THE PLANCHETTE. She rewinds again. Playing those few seconds over. Watching closely. It’s clear now that Debbie’s not moving the planchette. There’s a STRANGE BLUR on the screen. Laine enlarges the video image on her computer. CLOSER. There’s Laine’s hand Debbie’s hand -- and a THIRD GHOSTLY HAND also visible. Touching the planchette.  66. Laine freezes the image, thunderstruck by this new understanding. This was the actual first moment of contact with the spirit... and she was part of it. CLOSE ON A DOOR. We don't know where we are. Someone knocks. Beat. Footsteps on the other side. Click. The door unlocks and opens a bit. It's Laine's grandmother NO Looking now with concern at -- -- LAINE IN THE HALLWAY. Her eyes pleading for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning. Laine and Nona sit across from each other.

dialogues.speaker: NONA
dialogues.text: This is about the talking board... the one that was in your room.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NONA
dialogues.text: What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Something very bad. I didn't listen to you.

dialogues.speaker: NONA
dialogues.text: And Sarah... she's part of this as well? Laine nods -- 'yes, both of us.' Nona takes a heavy breath. Her words come carefully -- NONA (CONT’D) Most of us -- our spirits -- move on when we die. But for some, they remain very close to this world. If one of the living decides in their heart to reach out and find someone on the other side, a connection can be made to that Place. But to use such means can be a danger. You may knock, but it is uncertain who will answer. There are some spirits trapped in a Place of darkness and anger... forever seeking a way back into our world. It is possible that this entity you have been speaking with is someone who was evil in life... and now evil in the afterlife.  67. It's almost too much for Laine to take in.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: What can I do? Beat... Nona reaches out and takes Laine's hands.

dialogues.speaker: NONA
dialogues.text: Walk backwards in your footsteps -- to the beginning. There you can return things to where they were. (beat) You have opened a door to this other side, now you must close it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front of the school. The flag sits at half-mast against a gray morning sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Isabelle’s locker. A BUNCH OF STUDENTS have gathered. Many flowers placed in the hallway. Notes taped to the locker. The air heavy with the grief and shock of the dea of another student. Laine and Sarah approach. Trevor's already there. He seem lost in his shock, unraveling. Laine steps close to Trevo Just for him to hear --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- I was going back through a video of me and Debbie with the Ouija. I had no idea... that all of this started when Debbie and I played together that last time. (beat) I’m going to fix this, Trevor. Trevor stares at her for a long moment. His eyes unreadab Laine pulls out Isabelle’S PHONE, shows Trevor the ‘FNISH GAME’ photo. LAINE (CONT’D) That message. ‘Finish game. Debbie got it too. She never figured out how to end it. But we can. And then this is over.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You made us play. Trevor’s tone is so cold.  68. TREVOR (CONT’D) This D.Z. kills Debbie -- kills Isabelle. It's coming for all of us --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- we can stop it. Trevor suddenly explodes.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: You think you can do something? There’s nothing. Nothing we can do to stop it! STUDENTS turn. Now watching Laine and Trevor. Not understanding. Pete approaches, trying to ease the situat

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Whoa -- Trevor. Calm down. Suddenly Trevor PUNCHES Pete and slams him against the lockers. Laine and Sarah SCREAM OUT in shock.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: So who’s next?! You! Me?! The teacher MR. SATLOF hurries over to break up the fight

dialogues.speaker: MR. SATLOF
dialogues.text: Guys -- hey, knock it off! Laine is too paralyzed to even cry. Her world falling apa Trevor lets go of Pete, pushes through the crowd of stude and takes off down the hall. Pete wipes his face with his hand. Bleeding from the nose Laine reaches out to help him but he waves her off with a embarrassed look -- “I’m fine.” And then he heads off as well from the scene. MOMENTS LATER. The hallway has cleared. Mr. Satlof stands with Laine. She looks stunned. Totally lost. She can’t even make eye contact. MR. SATLOF (CONT’D) Losing two friends in such a short time -- emotions are all over the place right now. As we slowly ease in on Laine’s face...  69. MR. SATLOF (CONT’D) You need to talk to a counselor. It’s going to take a while to feel normal again, but you will overcome this, Laine. There’s so much life ahead for you. Laine glances up at Mr. Satlof for the first time. Vibrat with urgency.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: You’re wrong. There’s no time left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty auditorium. Mostly dark. A couple of work lights on stage reveal painted scenery flats for a school productio Laine wanders out onto the stage, looking around for Pete VOICE comes through the sound system.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If you're looking for me, I'm up here. Laine squints against the light and sees Pete in an enclo sound booth in the back of the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laine enters the small blacked-out space of the sound boo The inner domain of the theater ‘tech crew’ guys. Mixing console. Cable bundles. Laine finally breaks the silence

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Earlier, with Trevor --

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: -- he’s scared. We all are. Laine’s mind is running on fumes at this point.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: The last page in Debbie’s journal. She knew she was in danger. What was she trying to do in that final game? Off their look -- CLOSE ON A COMPUTER SCREEN. Internet searches about The Ouija. Clicking through pages. “Real Encounters of the Supernatural.” “Ouija: Myth or Magic?”  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laine and Pete are on the computer. Looking for anything that might help them. It’s all basic info.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Same stuff on all the sites. Laine gets up. She goes to the window that looks out into the auditorium. Everything feels like a dead end. Pete stays at the computer. He types. Clicks. Types again Clicks. Starts reading something on the screen --

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Hey. Come look at this. There’s now a PARANORMAL WEBSITE pulled up on the compute

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I entered ‘Ouija’ and the initials ‘D.Z.’ into a search and this is what came up. I guess this happened a while back. Laine clicks into an article. The HEADLINE: “Friends Die Tragic House Fire.” She starts to read --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: ‘Investigators never found a cause for a fire that took the lives of three high school students while they slept.’ As Laine reads, we glimpse accompanying PHOTOS (circa ear 80's) that are on the webpage. Three TEENAGE GIRLS hangin out in a bedroom. Making faces. And playing a OUIJA. LAINE (CONT’D) ‘But there were rumors that the girls had been playing with a Ouija board.’

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: ‘Other friends from school confirmed the reports. And that the name of the spirit during contact went by the initials D.z.’ Hearing those same initials, it’s like Laine has the wind knocked out of her.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: This has happened before... Pete keeps reading --  71.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: ‘In our research, these initials have appeared in other instances in which players suffered various outcomes... sudden death due to unexplained accidents... cases where people simply vanished... never seen again --’ Laine clicks on another PHOTO on the website. FIRE INVESTIGATORS sifting through the remains of the burned d house. Laine clicks another photo of the destruction -- a notices something. She enlarges the image. There -- amidst the charred remai of the house -- a OUIJA BOARD. Uncannily undamaged by the fire. And then another photo of the back of the board. ANOTHER PHOTO. A BLACK SMUDGE on the back of the board. T shape... it looks like a HANDPRINT. Laine turns to Pete, her nerves shredded. He’s on the sam wavelength. The world feels like it’s closing in on them.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: My god. ‘Finish game.’ I thought it was a message -- something we had to do to end this. But it’s his pattern. D.Z. kills all the players. And then he’s finished. Moves on to the next game...

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: .---and it starts all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights are off. A TEACHER lectures at the front of the ro projecting science charts on a screen. DRIFT DOWN A ROW OF DESKS to Sarah sitting in the far bac An empty desk behind her. Sarah's finding it hard to pay attention to the lecture. thoughts stray. She sets her pen down. Closes her eyes. Takes a breath. Trying to tune things out, but something doesn’t feel rig Sarah opens her eyes. The dim light in the classroom shif as the teacher advances to another chart. Sarah glances down at her desk. Her pen sitting there. Beat... and then it twitches.  72. She keeps staring. Maybe that didn’t just happen. Everything is very still... the droning voice of the teac at the front of the class... and the pen twitches again. Very slowly, as if being moved by some unseen force, it starts to slide across her desk. Sarah watches in disbelief. Can’t pull her eyes away. Thi seems impossible and yet it’s happening. Right here in class! The pen continues its eerie drift from one side of her desk to the other. She looks over at the student across the aisle from her.. wondering if anyone else is seeing this. But the guy has eyes up front. Taking notes. BACK ON SARAH... staring... the pen still moving like som kind of dreamy time-lapse. CLICK. Another projection chart. And in the momentary shi of the light... we see that SOMEONE -- an out-of-focus fi -- is now sitting in that last desk behind Sarah that was empty just moments ago. Sarah doesn’t notice, entranced by the pen as it edges cl and closer toward her hand. BEHIND HER. The DARK FIGURE slightly tilts his head. Cold glints where the eyes should be... just like the glimpse what we saw in the back seat of Isabelle’s car. ON SARAH'S DESK... as the pen finishes its way across the desk... and then quickly slips right into Sarah’s hand. THE DARK FIGURE BEHIND HER -- leans in closer, suddenly - Sarah's hand JERKS across the desk as she starts SCRAWLIN JAGGED LETTERS OUT ON THE COVER OF HER NOTEBOOK. Pen snapping. Ink smearing. And Sarah can't control it. She can barely speak --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Help... somebody help me. Sarah frantically looks around the classroom. It’s all shadows. No one notices her. The TEACHER lecturing. The HUM of the projector. Everything so far away. Like Sarah' desk is in a separate dimension. The pen SCRATCHES into the notebook. MORE LETTERS being scrawled out in messy smears of ink. Can’t see what it sa in the dark. Sarah's literally crying. So helpless. Fighting to resist but there’s nothing she can do. Finally, her hand comes t stop. Her pen drops and clatters to the floor.  73. Frozen beat. And now Sarah feels it. SOMEONE sitting behi her. She slowly turns around in her seat... daring a glan back... seeing something we don’t see. Her eyes going wid -- and then WHOOSH!! Her whole desk SLIDES across the flo of the classroom! SMASHING HARD INTO A WALL. INSTANT COMMOTION in the class. The lights are still off. Dim light from the projector. STUDENTS trying to see what happened. Sarah’s tumped over on the floor. Her wild eyes shooting the desk that was behind her -- and it’s empty. No one sitting there. TEACHER'S VOICE calls out --

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Sarah, what the hell’s going on back there?! Everyone settle down. Sarah grabs her NOTEBOOK and scrambles up. Moves through dark toward the door. Has to get out of here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah bursts from the classroom -- RIGHT INTO LAINE AND P IN THE HALLWAY. Laine sees how panicked her sister is. The tears on her face. And Sarah keeps looking back at the classroom door.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Sarah, what is it --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: -- he’s here.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: Wait. What happened? Sarah’s looking everywhere. Paranoid. Doesn’t even feel safe standing in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He’s here. Following us wherever we go. Laine glimpses Sarah’s NOTEBOOK clutched in her arms -- t jagged carved letters. She gently takes the notebook from Sarah. It doesn’t look like anything, until she turns it upside down. A MESSAGE --

dialogues.speaker: FINSH GAME
dialogues.text: And now in the light, Sarah finally sees the message as w She stares with a sick look.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty neighborhood lot. Trevor sits at the curb next his bike. He checks his cell phone, looks up as Pete's ca pulls up across the street. Laine gets out of the car and approaches. Pete and Sarah hang back, giving them some space.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Got your text. (beat) Hey, those things I said...

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: You’re here now. That’s all that matters.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: So... why are we here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT. In the fading light of day, Laine, Trevor, Pet and Sarah walk through the tall dead grass... heading tow the spot where they burned the Ouija board. Sarah stops. Doesn’t want to go any further. Laine continues on... walks up to a spot in the dirt. Bla charred bits of wood and grey ash. Remnants from the fire Laine leans down, brushes away the ash. Pete and Trevor stand over her shoulder... watching. Laine keeps sweeping the ash away with her hand... a fami antique font alphabet appearing underneath. It’s the OUIJA BOARD. Totally intact. As if the fire neve touched it. The PLANCHETTE too. Not burned. It’s perfect. Everyone stares. It’s a nightmare they can’t escape. Laine stands with the board in her hands. Beat. She turns it over. And there's a BLACK SMUDGE on the back. That sam CREEPY HANDPRINT we glimpsed in the Ouija internet articl

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: I saw this before. On Debbie's video... she was standing in the mirror. Something was on her skin. It was this. A handprint. His handprint. (beat) Is that what he's doing? Marking us. Telling us who's next.  75. Pete, Trevor and Laine check themselves. Nothing. And the Laine looks over at Sarah... standing there with her slee pulled to her wrist. Laine doesn't even need to say anything.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don't make me look. I don't want to know... Laine comes over... gently pulls one of Sarah's sleeves u Nothing there. Pulls the other one up... and there's the DARK HANDPRINT on her forearm.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm next. I'm going to die... Sarah frantically tries to wipe away the black handprint. She’s totally losing it. Laine takes her sister’s face... trying to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: No. I won’t let that happen. We have to play one last time and then it’s over. Do you trust me? Sarah holds the look with Laine -- nods. EXT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - DUSK Sun setting. Trees casting long shadows. EASE IN on the dark windows... INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS The downstairs is totally still for a long beat... then a FIGURE moves through the shadowed house. Stepping through the broken mirror shards on the floorboards. It’s DEBBIE’S MOTHER. She walks slowly. Eyes searching. Expectant. She freezes at hearing a dull SLIDING sound coming from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GALARDI
dialogues.text: Debbie? INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - STAIRS - MOMENTS LATER Debbie’s mother stands at the bottom of the stairs lookin up. She reaches for the handrail and begins to head up... passing photos of her daughter along the wall. Debbie’s f distorted by the shadows on the glass as she passes.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GALARDI
dialogues.text: Are you here, baby? Let me see you -- I need to see you. From upstairs... that dull SLIDING sound again.  76. Mrs. Galardi keeps moving up the stairway. Suddenly, she stops. Gasping at the sight of -- -- a DARK FIGURE standing at the very top of the stairs b the wall. The face is concealed with one of Debbie’s pain theatre MASKS. Mrs. Galardi smiles in astonishment. Her eyes alive.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GALARDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I knew it. I knew you were here. THE FIGURE just stands there. Not moving. Mrs. Galardi continues up the stairs, almost to the top.. now just inches away from the FIGURE. MRS. GALARDI (CONT’D) I want to see that beautiful face .+.Just once more. Mrs. Galardi reaches out with trembling hands and slowly begins to lift the mask. We don’t see what she sees -- -- as the smile fades from her face. Mrs. Galardi stares with the most devastating expression of dawning horror. A then it’s as if she simply can’t take what she’s looking and she SCREAMS. Loses her footing on the stairs. Suddenl

dialogues.speaker: STUMBLES BACKWARDS --
dialogues.text: EXT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Pete’s car pulls up. Everyone gets out, but Laine instant sees something that makes her face fall -- MRS. GALARDI’S EMPTY CAR. Parked out in front of Debbie’s house like before. Driver’s side door wide open. Laine turns -- sees that the front door is cracked open. hurries toward the house. INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT Laine moves past the same bits of broken mirror on the fl Scanning the dark. The house absolutely silent. Laine keeps going. She rounds the corner to the stairs... glances up to see that they are empty. Beat... about to m on... looking down -- and there’s that MASK at the bottom the steps. Icy beat. Laine stares. Reaches down to pick it up -- -- WHEN SOMEONE SUDDENLY GRABS HER ARMS! Laine staggers i shock. It’s MRS. GALARDI. Crawling out from the shadows. Dazed and hurt from a bad fall down the stairs. Grabbing onto Laine in a blind panic.  77. Laine kneels down with Mrs. Galardi.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: It’s alright. I’m here. I’m right here. But Mrs. Galardi keeps staring up at the top of the stair

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GALARDI
dialogues.text: -- not alone -- she wasn’t alone --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang on -- I’m going to call for help. And now Debbie’s mother raises an arm and points up. Lain turns in that direction... looking toward the top of the stairs. But it’s just emptiness up there.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT SILENT AND DREAM-LIKE. Laine in the street, talking with POLICE OFFICER. Answering questions. MRS. GALARDI is load into an ambulance. Doors shut. THROUGH THE AMBULANCE DOORS as it pulls away. Looking out Laine through the back window... getting smaller as she stands there in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laine enters the backyard. The others are already here. Waiting. The mood is so grim.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: She hit her head pretty hard. They think she fell down the stairs. But she’1ll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: D.Z. did that to her. Because it doesn’t want anyone else in the house.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Only us...

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Caminar hacia atrds en las huellas, al principio.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Sarah trades a look with Laine.  78.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: ‘Walk backwards in our footsteps.’

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: It’s how we stop him. They turn and look up at the dark house, knowing they hav go inside. A NIGHT WIND starts to rise as we go -- POV OF TREVOR'S VIDEO CAMERA. Set up like before. Same angle on the Ouija board. INT. DEBBIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Just like the previous games, everyone is in place around Ouija board. But now -- only FOUR PLAYERS instead of five One by one, each player puts their fingertips on the planchette. Laine offers a final caution --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: What we all did to make contact, we now have to do in reverse. That’s how we close the door. (beat) No matter what happens, don’t take your hand away. The air is absolutely electric. Laine begins, saying the words we've heard before, but backwards --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You to call... we near spirits... ...true are hearts... gathered... we have friends... as... Everything’s quiet. Laine glances at the others. LAINE (CONT’D) Now four times around the board. One for each of us. Backwards. Together they circle the board -- counter-clockwise -- wi the planchette. Very cautiously. Completing a full cycle.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Okay. One down...

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Keep going... Hope rising. They start the second circle, and THE PLANCHETTE STARTS TO VIBRATE AND RATTLE against the surfa of the board.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: It’s D.Z.  79. They keep pushing at the planchette, but it’s as if the p is suddenly heavy. Hard to move.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s pushing back. There’s a DEEP, LOW GROAN somewhere in the house. VIDEO CAMERA ANGLE -- Eyes dart. Everyone heard that.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: He knows what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Do not stop. THE IMAGE GLITCHES -- like we saw before when Laine was watching the footage of Debbie's games. And in the momentary distortion, beyond the four players sitting around the board... there is ANOTHER PRESENCE in shadows. BACK WITH THE GROUP -- FINGERTIPS PUSHING. Veins in hands straining. The planchette finally finishing the second circle. That OTHERWORLDLY GROAN IN THE HOUSE -- LOUDER! Sounds as it’s moving behind the walls. Across the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Two more. C’mon c’mon c’mon -- They start to move the planchette -- and somewhere in the darkness a DOOR SLAMS! The sound THUNDERS THROUGH THE HOU

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: It’s not working... it’s not working...

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Goddammit. Focus. (calling out into the room) D.Z. -- we know you’re here. We're ending the game! And everyone keeps PUSHING THE PLANCHETTE as it seems to literally fight against their efforts. The third circle complete. On to the last... LAINE (CONT’D) We can do this.  80. The planchette inches... slowly moving... THE UNGODLY NOI in the house rises -- LOUDER -- the planchette finishes t fourth and final circle around the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAINE (CONT’D) Hurry. Move it to ‘Good Bye’ and we're done. Together, they move the planchette toward the words at th bottom of the board -- but it stops. RATTLING in place. Won’t go any further. An incredible force pushing back against them. The lanterns FLICKER AND DIM. THE GROANING SOUND falls aw as everything becomes eerily quiet. LAINE (CONT’D) C’mon... almost there. A breathless beat -- -- as the lantern softly FLICKERS. Faster. Now strobe-lik BLASTS OF LIGHT and then total darkness. Over and over. And in those FLASHES -- glimpses of a FIFTH PERSON NOW SITTING WITH THE OTHERS AT THE BOARD. An 18-year-old YOUN MAN. Ghostly. Eyes filled with menace. It’s D.Z. Everyone sees him. Holy shit! Another FLASH of light -- and now he’s gone. Back into darkness. Sarah’s SCREAM suddenly fills the roo Laine looks over. Face going slack --

dialogues.speaker: -- BECAUSE SARAH'S BEING LIFTED KICKING AND SCREAMING OFF
dialogues.text: FLOOR! Something shadowy and mostly unseen is behind her holding her -- making it look like Sarah’s levitating in rapid-fire strobes of light. And then -- WHOOSH! Sarah goes flying across the room. OU

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE UPSTAIRS HALLWAY. THE BEDROOM DOOR SLAMMING SHUT
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. Everyone scrambles up from the floor and run to the door. Trying to get it open. Sarah SCREAMS from th other side --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Laine! Help me!

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Hang on! From the space at the bottom of the door, Sarah’s fingers desperately reach out. Feeling out onto the floor.  81. Laine crouches down -- holds her sister’s hands while Tre and Pete struggle with the door. LAINE (CONT’D) I got you!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s here, Laine! Laine holds tight, but now Sarah is totally frantic in th hallway. Like she’s not out there alone. Her fingers slip away... right out of Laine’s grasp. As Trevor and Pete finally get the door open -- -- INTO THE HALLWAY. And Sarah's not there. Laine takes i the empty hallway.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Where the hell is she                        !

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No answer. Laine grabs a flashlight. CLICK. The three of them move down the upstairs hallway. All we see are their faces in the light. UP AHEAD -- the various bedroom doors. More darkness with each room. It feels like anything could be waiting around the next corner... THE THREE SPLIT UP -- their lights moving away from each other. Into rooms... down the stairs... INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - PARENTS’ ROOM - NIGHT Pete checks the parents’ bedroom. Searching the dark. Moving fast. Everything looks so normal. The neatly made bed. Vanity table. Woman’s dress hanging on an armoire. FROM BEHIND A CURTAIN. Hiding from this vantage point. Watching Pete search the dark room. BACK WITH PETE. He turns and notices the curtains. The la place he hasn’t checked. He moves toward them. Reaches ou and whips the curtain aside... ...-but no one’s there. INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - DOWNSTAIRS HALLWAY - NIGHT LIGHT SWEEPS ACROSS OUR VISION -- it’s LAINE.  82. Laine moves toward a CLOSED DOOR with her light. A LOW, AWFUL SOUND rises... Laine stops. Breathing hard. Listening. As the sound MOVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CEILING -- and then off into the house. Like a presence passing. Quiet again... Laine summons her resolve... arrives at the CLOSED DOOR. Beat. She quickly twists the door knob and pushes into -- THE GARAGE. Laine shines her light into the dark corners, but Sarah’s not here. Laine’s desperation grows. She calls out --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Sarah?! Can you hear me? Behind her in the hallway -- SOMEONE’S NOW STANDING THERE the shadows. The faintest whispery voice --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Laaainne... THE FIGURE moves. Not walking. They eerily slide out of view... off into the house. Laine turns -- not seeing anyone. ELSEWHERE. WITH TREVOR -- heading toward the back of the house. Lantern sweeping the shadows. No sign of Sarah. Trevor swings the light over toward the sliding glass doo leading to the back. It’s OPEN. He steps closer -- ‘Is Sarah out there?’ EXT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - NIGHT Trevor is now out back. Night wind blowing. Leaves SKITTERING across the pool cover... Trevor scans the area. His light sweeps across patio furniture... but no sign of Sarah. A SOUND. BEHIND HIM. Trevor turns. Holding his light out. Everything still. A WATERY SOUND... ..-.as A SHAPE MOVES BENEATH THE POOL COVER. Something’s in the water. At first he can’t believe it. A trick of the eyes. Trevor steps toward the edge of the pool... A SICK GURGLING SOUN as the SHAPE moves again under the pool cover.  83.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Sarah! Trevor moves fast. He reaches down... peels the pool cove back... brackish water underneath. Impossible to see anything as -- -- AN EXPLOSIVE SPLASH! LANTERN DROPS TO THE CONCRETE. -- and Trevor is VIOLENTLY PULLED INTO THE POOL! Disappearing under the surface of the water. The pool settles. Quiet. Stay here for as long as we can get away with. We’re now literally holding our breath. Waiting for Trevor to come up... ...-but he never does. INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS WITH PETE. At the back sliding glass door. He hears the soft lapping of the pool, looks out -- sees the fallen lantern lying on the concrete... but no Trevor. EXT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - BACKYARD - CONTINUOUS PETE RUNS FOR THE POOL. Arrives at the edge. Shines his light down into the dark water. Can’t see Trevor. Pete reaches in... his hands searching... water splashing everywhere... desperate -- -- AND THEN HE GRABS HOLD OF SOMETHING. Pulls. It’s TREVOR. Coming up out of the water. Head sagging. Drenched. Lifeless.

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No no no... Trevor, c’mon. Pete strains with everything he’s got and manages to hois Trevor out of the pool. Lays him on the concrete. Trevor doesn’t move at all. Pete puts his ear to Trevor’s chest... listens for a heartbeat. His expression says it all -- this isn’t good. Pete shakes Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: PETE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trevor -- Nothing. Trevor’s not moving. Not breathing. Pete puts his hands into CPR position. He pumps on Trevor chest. Again. Again. --  84. -- Trevor's whole body JOLTS as he coughs up water. Gasps for breath. Eyes blinking. Taking in air. He finally focuses on Pete. Realizes he just saved his life. Pete holds a look with him -- relieved. INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS Laine enters a bathroom. Clutching her light in the darkness. She scans the small space. No sign of Sarah... about to leave when -- -- there’s a sound. Coming from behind the glass shower door. A dull THUMP... THUMP. Laine turns. Stares at the shower. She waits for the soun to come again, but it’s just silence. She takes a step closer. Flashlight trembling in her grip Trying to see through the opaque shower door glass. Another step -- and THUMP! Something SLAMS against the ot side of the glass. A DISTORTED FIGURE. One HAND -- then another SLAMS against the glass! Laine FREAKS! Swings her light wildly as -- -- the shower door CREAKS open and THE FIGURE stumbles ou

dialogues.speaker: COLLIDING RIGHT INTO LAINE
dialogues.text: Laine’s light finally settles to see that it’s Sarah. Her eyes are dazed. She looks totally disoriented. Traumatize

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laine holds her sister. Brushing the hair out of her face Sarah’s so scared, trying to get the words out --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He told me... Her voice fades. Eyes unable to focus.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Hey. It’s me. Sarah? It’s Laine. Are you hurt? Talk to me. Sarah is falling apart. Shaking all over like she has hypothermia.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He’s playing with us.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Just breathe.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is the only thing he wants... that taste of life again. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He finishes with us and then it’s another game. It keeps going and going... EASE IN ON LAINE -- as she’s suddenly hit with a MEMORY. DEBBIE. ON THE VIDEO. Playing the Ouija alone in her room

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Let's start a new game. How does that sound? Okay. Good. Here we go. SNAP BACK TO LAINE -- a revelation now clear to her.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Another game... that’s what she was doing. Trying to protect me... Beat. Laine puts her flashlight into Sarah’s hands. LAINE (CONT’D) Sarah -- I want you to stay right here. You'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t leave me.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Wait, why are you saying that --

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: -- no matter what happens, you remember that. Okay, Worm? Laine’s pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Laine! But she’s gone. Hurrying off into the dark house. INT. DEBBIE’S ROOM - NIGHT THE OUIJA sits on the floor. Right where the group left i Lantern to the side. The board seems larger than life. Laine steps into the doorway in the background. Regards t board. Heavy. She comes into the room and closes the door Locks it. Laine kneels down at the Ouija. She hesitates -- then pla her fingertips on the planchette.  86. She slowly starts to circle the board. Clockwise. One tim

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: As friends we've gathered, hearts are true. Spirits near, we call to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you. (beat) D.Z. -- if you’re here, make your presence known. It's now clear what Laine’s doing -- she’s here to play t game alone. SUDDENLY -- A STRANGE POV. Looking up at Laine through th Ouija board. Like it’s a window into the room. The letter and words on the board are all backwards. And the sound i this place -- an evil LOW GROANING like a rising storm. BACK WITH LAINE in the shadowy room. LAINE (CONT’D) Just tell me that you’re here. Talk to me. EASE IN ON THE PLANCHETTE. Totally still. A twitch under Laine’s fingertips. The planchette moves. Spells out the familiar greeting -- HI FREND LAINE (CONT’D) Hi friend. Then our game has started. (beat) I know something about you... all the games you've played before. The terrible things you have done. The entire room seems to react with menace. A dull wind i the dark blowing against Laine. LAINE (CONT’D) You move game to game. One to the next. And now you're playing with me. Just the two of us. That means the last game is over. You can’t hurt my friends... can’t hurt my sister. Not anymore. The planchette RATTLES on the board. There’s an angry ene in the room. LAINE (CONT’D) But I’m here. I’m ready.  87. INT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - DOWNSTAIRS - NIGHT Pete and the still soaking wet Trevor hurry through the house. Their light catching sight of Sarah. But Trevor immediately notices that Laine’s absent.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Where’s Laine?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: She went upstairs. With a sick realization --

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: She’s with the Ouija. Alone. INT. DEBBIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Laine is still at the board. Fingers still in place. The LANTERN flickers as Laine’s hit by an angry uncanny b of wind. An angry energy filling the room. The closet door swings open. The mirror mounted to the inside, reveals Laine's reflection. She gasps at the sigh of a prominent large black HANDPRINT now on her arm. She been marked! And then she sees in the reflection -- BEHIND HER -- some standing there. It’s D.%Z. He reaches out toward her with strange stuttering arm. Suddenly -- THE MIRROR CRACKS. Spiderwebs. A loose shard rattles in the mirror -- then sucked away b the wind. Flies across the room. The sharp piece SLICES Laine’s cheek. Draws blood. There’s POUNDING on the other side of the door. Trevor's voice faintly yelling under the rising chaos in Debbie’s room. WHOOSH! Debbie’s shelves slide in front of the door. No one’s getting in. Laine shoots a look to the door. Knows she’s trapped. Bathed in a little island of lantern light in the inky bl that surrounds her. This is where she’s going to die. She takes a brave breath. Closes her eyes. Ready. SLOWLY MOVE DOWN LAINE TO THE PLANCHETTE, rattling on the board -- as OTHER HANDS reach in. Fingertips touching.  88. Laine senses something. Opens her eyes. Astonished to see that SOMEONE is sitting across from her. Playing the game It’s a TEENAGE GIRL. The girl looks up with sad eyes... It's DEBBIE. Laine whispers in amazement. Totally overcome with emotio to see her old friend sitting across from her.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Debbie...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Never play alone, Laine. The way Debbie says these words... so full of regret. Lai starts to cry. And Debbie does too. Debbie looks around her room. At all of her things. And then sees her bracelet on Laine's wrist. She reaches out touches it. A piece of her living on through Laine.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: I should've been there for you. I'm so sorry. If I could do it all over again... Debbie smiles through her tears. All is forgiven between them. But Debbie’s smile slowly fades, sensing something -- and she suddenly spins and looks behind her. Terrified

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Laine -- he’s coming. The LANTERN flickers. In the flash of light, DEBBIE NOW LOOKS HORRENDOUS! Plastic dry cleaning bag wrapped tight around her screaming twitching head. Another LAMP flicker -- back to normal. A part of her stu here. Can’t move on. DEBBIE (CONT’D) Take your hands away. Laine shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: No! I'm not leaving you again. The vibe in the room grows more intense. All around them, FIGURE drifts in and out of the shadows. There! Then over there! It feels like being in the very heart of evil. The PLANCHETTE twitches across the board.  89.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You have to, Laine... you have to say goodbye. Laine is crying harder. Shaking her head. Terrified but willing to die right here.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You need to go, Laine. Live a good life. Do great things... The two girls lock eyes with each other.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...for me. Laine is overcome. Can barely get the words out.

dialogues.speaker: LAINE
dialogues.text: Good bye... Laine pulls her hands away from the board. Alone, Debbie does a reverse circle around the board. Finally moves the planchette to GOOD BYE, but she’s looki at Laine when she says...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Goodbye. THE ROOM IS RATTLING LIKE HELL. Everything reaching a fin pitch fury -- Debbie is now looking over Laine’s shoulder. Laine slowly turns-- glances behind her -- A DARK FIGURE STANDS THERE. Hovering above them. The uncanny wind howli and storming around Laine. Suddenly -- DEBBIE ERUPTS in her own fury. For a split second, that disturbing death appearance of the plastic b around her twitching head. FLASH. Then normal again. She bolts off the floor. Takes four running steps at THE FIGURE. Both of them falling back into the shadows. The WIND ON LAINE IS FEROCIOUS. She SCREAMS! Can barely hear her. The LANTERN FLICKERS HARD then total darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor SHOVES at the door. Finally gets it open --  90. INT. DEBBIE’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS -- he bursts into the room -- -- to find that everything is totally still. He shines hi light around the room. The calm after the storm. Laine’s not here. It’s just the board sitting on the middle of the floor. A smear of blood on it. Next to the board, the planchette. It’s literally cracked in half. Sarah moves in behind Trevor. Taking in the room. Doesn’t see her sister anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Laine? And Sarah starts sobbing. Fearing the worst. Trevor holds her. Both of them speechless. Pete crouches down. Nudges the broken planchette with his flashlight. Taking in the stillness of the room. A faint sound. He shines his light over by the bed. Can’t see anything. Pete moves forward... closer... around the side of the bed. And there’s LAINE. Huddled in a corner. Her head buried i her arm. Pete gently reaches out... touches her. Laine glances up. Surprised to see him. Surprised that she’s even here. Laine looks at her arm -- the handprint mark that was there is gone. Sarah turns. Sees her sister. Races over to her. Crying even harder now. They hold each other. Not letting go. EXT. DEBBIE’S HOUSE - NIGHT PULL AWAY from the house. The horror truly feels over. Th spirit moving on to the next game. Somewhere out there...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE. A PIECE OF PARCHMENT. Letters appearing one by one spelling out the name DEBORAH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trees. Grass. WE FIND LAINE... at Debbie’s grave. Making rubbing of her headstone. Finished, she pulls the parchme away, revealing the full inscription:  gl. Deborah Galardi - A Friend Forever SARAH, TREVOR AND PETE are standing here too. They all pl a flower at the grave and then step away. Allowing Laine have a final moment. Laine places her single white flower among the others. Sh kisses her fingers, touches the headstone. Laine rises. A last look... and she steps away. ROLL CREDITS over a haunting, female vocal cover version Morrissey's “Ouija Board, Ouija Board.” Ouija board Would you work for me? I have got to say hello To an old friend And for those who stay all the way until the very end of credits, they are rewarded with a final tag: BLACK. We hear a GUY'S VOICE --

dialogues.speaker: GUY'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here it is. The moment we've all been waiting for. IMAGE COMES UP. A guy on screen, speaking directly to the camera. We recognize him as HIP PODCAST GUY from earlier when Sarah was on her computer.

dialogues.speaker: HIP PODCAST GUY
dialogues.text: One million people online, right now -- ready to play the world's biggest game of Ouija. What are we waiting for? Let's do this. Hand on your mouse. The image of a virtual OUIJA BOARD comes up and fills the screen. The layout and lettering identical to the actual game. The planchette circles the board in a clockwise motion.

dialogues.speaker: HIP PODCAST GUY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is there a spirit with us now? Please let us know that you are here. Beat... then the planchette on screen moves up to the YES PULL AWAY FROM THE SCREEN... into a bedroom... we see a h resting on the computer mouse. KEEP PANNING UP to reveal that it's SARAH. Sitting at her laptop in her room.  92.

dialogues.speaker: HIP PODCAST GUY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, this is seriously cool. Spirit, can you tell us your name? ON THE SCREEN -- the planchette sits there. Then slowly starts to move. Across the letters... keeps moving... SARAH watches... waiting... As the planchette finally lands on the letter "D." Whoa. Sarah clicks out of the screen. The online Ouija ga is gone. She sits there. Lets out a breath. Never again. Sarah clicks the mouse, and now something else comes up o screen. Solitaire. Nice safe Solitaire. PULL BACK FROM SARAH as she begins to play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS SHOTS. Different houses. The distinctive blue glo of computer screens from bedroom windows. We catch glimpses through curtains and blinds. Other peop with the OUIJA board on their computer. Playing. WIDE SHOT. The vast sprawl of the suburbs before us. All those houses. All those people. Glimmers of lights in the windows. The world's biggest Ouija game is underway... FADE OUT.
